intro: Mackenziea, commonly known as the Mackenziea tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its woody structure and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in a variety of habitats, including heathlands and open forests. Mackenziea species are known for their small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. These plants play an important ecological role in their native environments, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
